Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a healthy plant that has enough water with clear features like green leaves and standing upright stems.
The student can draw a wilted plant that does not have enough water, showing drooping leaves and stems.
The student can use their drawings to suggest that water is essential for plants by depicting a side-by-side comparison.
CANNOT: The student might inconsistently show less obvious patterns, such as leaf discoloration (e.g., may miss yellowing as a sign of lack of water).
The student may not explicitly label parts of the plant or effects of water, assuming the drawing speaks for itself (e.g., labeling leaves and roots).
